definition[0]: to become damaged and useless, or to make something like this, by using it a lot or for a long time
example[0]: My boots are beginning to wear out.
example[1]: He travels so much he actually wears out suitcases.
definition[1]: to make someone feel extremely tired
example[2]: All this shopping has worn us out.
example[3]: Illness and death came suddenly; over the years she had simply worn herself out.
definition[2]: to stay with someone longer than they want you to
